SEARCH
Package se.ju23.typespeeder.util

Class ResultUtil

java.lang.Object
se.ju23.typespeeder.util.ResultUtil
public class ResultUtil extends Object
Version:
0.1.0

ResultUtil

ResultUtil is a helper class to the GameService class. This class contains the following static methods:
  • calculateNumOfCorrect
  • calculateNumOfMostCorrectInOrder
  • calculateNumOfQuestionMarks
  • getAccuracyRoundedToTwoDigits
  • calculatePointsFromAccuracy
  • getLevelFromPoints
  • getMinimumPointsForLevel
These methods contain pure logic and are used in the GameService class.
Author:
Depinder Kaur

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static int
    calculateNumOfCorrect(String gameContent, String userInput)
    This method returns the number of letters which are at the correct position in the user input when compared to the game content.
    static int
    calculateNumOfMostCorrectInOrder(String gameContent, String userInput)
    This method calculates the num of letters which are at the correct position in the user input till a mismatch occurs when compared to the chosen game's content.
    static int
    calculateNumOfQuestionMarks(String gameContent)
    This method calculates the number of ? present in the content of the chosen game.

    This method calculates points depending upon the given value of accuracy.

    This method calculates accuracy from two given numbers and returns its value rounded to two decimal places.
    static int
    getLevelFromPoints(int points)
    This method returns the level number depending upon the points earned by the user.
    static int

    This method returns the minimum number of points needed to stay at a specific level.

  • Constructor Details

    • ResultUtil

      public ResultUtil()

  • Method Details

    • calculateNumOfCorrect

      public static int calculateNumOfCorrect(String gameContent, String userInput)
      This method returns the number of letters which are at the correct position in the user input when compared to the game content.
      Parameters:
      gameContent - This is content of the game chosen by the user.
      userInput - This is the input given by user.
      Returns:
      The number of letters at the correct position in the user input.

    • calculateNumOfMostCorrectInOrder

      public static int calculateNumOfMostCorrectInOrder(String gameContent, String userInput)
      This method calculates the num of letters which are at the correct position in the user input till a mismatch occurs when compared to the chosen game's content.
      Parameters:
      gameContent - This is content of the game chosen by the user.
      userInput - This is the input given by user.
      Returns:
      The number of letters most correct in order.

    • calculateNumOfQuestionMarks

      public static int calculateNumOfQuestionMarks(String gameContent)
      This method calculates the number of ? present in the content of the chosen game.
      Parameters:
      gameContent - This is the content of the game being played.
      Returns:
      The number of ? in the content of the game.

    • getAccuracyRoundedToTwoDigits

      public static double getAccuracyRoundedToTwoDigits(int num, int total)
      This method calculates accuracy from two given numbers and returns its value rounded to two decimal places.
      Parameters:
      num - Any integer, but here it is the number of correct/most correct in order in the user's input.
      total - Any integer, but here it is the total number of characters in the chosen game's content.
      Returns:
      The accuracy calculated to two decimal places.

    • calculatePointsFromAccuracy

      public static int calculatePointsFromAccuracy(double accuracy)
      This method calculates points depending upon the given value of accuracy. Note that if the accuracy is below 10, then the user gets -1 point.
      Parameters:
      accuracy - It is a double value, but rounded-off to two decimal places.
      Returns:
      Points as an integer value.

    • getLevelFromPoints

      public static int getLevelFromPoints(int points)
      This method returns the level number depending upon the points earned by the user.
      Parameters:
      points - These are the total points earned by the user which decide the user's current level.
      Returns:
      Level number according to the given points.

    • getMinimumPointsForLevel

      public static int getMinimumPointsForLevel(int level)
      This method returns the minimum number of points needed to stay at a specific level.
      Parameters:
      level - Level number
      Returns:
      Minimum points needed to stay on the given level.
